page.title: 06Transport in Ousden
page.content: Most households with the exception of the elderly own at least one car, many having 2. The 16-17 year olds have mopeds and small motorcycles and as soon as they are old enough at 17 the majority learn to drive cars. As the nearest towns are between 8 adn 10 miles away, people need their own transport for getting to and from work, and for pleasure. If you want to go any distance of an evening, a car is essential. There is a very limited bus service which serves the centre of the village from Newmarket and Bury St Edmunds can be reached. As there is no school all the children are transported by school buses or cars. Some people are very concerned at the lack of speed limits and of dangerous parking. There are a lot of public footpaths across private land, but very few use them these days.
